column_description: Timestamp indicating when a P2P inward transaction was created, used as the primary temporal dimension for filtering and comparing transaction volumes across different time periods (today vs yesterday, current date vs same day last month) in performance dashboards.

Represents the hour of the day (0-23) when P2P inward payment transactions occurred, used for hourly time-series analysis and comparison of transaction volumes across different time periods in the payments dashboard.

Unique identifier for peer-to-peer inward payment transactions where Paytm users receive money from other payment service providers. This ID is used to count and track transaction volumes across different time periods for business analytics and performance monitoring.

Represents the latest hour (in numeric format) for which P2P inward transaction data has been processed and is available in the hourly reporting dataset. This column is used as an upper boundary filter to ensure analysis only includes data up to the most recent processed hour.

A varchar identifier that represents the payment service provider (PSP) handle for the payee (recipient) in peer-to-peer inward transactions, used to filter and categorize transactions by the receiving party's PSP such as 'ptaxis' for AXIS bank.

Identifier for the payment service provider (PSP) handle of the payer in P2P inward transactions, used to categorize transactions by whether they originate from Paytm or other payment platforms for business analysis and comparison.
